alert.note: Alert for Brunswick; Dinwiddie; Greensville; Prince George; Sussex (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 03 at 7:17PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Greensville, southwestern Prince George, western Sussex, southeastern Dinwiddie and central Brunswick Counties through 800 PM EDT... At 716 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Dinwiddie to near Purdy to near Brunswick. Movement was east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Petersburg, Lawrenceville, Purdy, Jarratt, Stony Creek, Radium, Carson, Bufford Crossroads, Reams, Pleasant Shade, Fields Crossroads, Wharfs Store, Huske, Cowie Corner, New Bohemia, Owens, Callaville, Templeton, Cherry Hill and Edgerton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects.

area.areaDesc: Brunswick; Dinwiddie; Greensville; Prince George; Sussex
